alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 27 at 3:38AM PDT until March 29 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow at times. Snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches above 8,000 feet, 5 to 10 inches between 7,000 and 8,000 feet, and 1 to 5 inches from 6,000 to 7,000 feet. Strong winds from 20 to 40 mph. * WHERE...The Riverside County mountains above 6,000 feet. * WHEN...From Noon Monday through 9 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
